rows.headline: Alfonso Cuarón revisits the sights and sounds of the neighborhood that inspired his critically acclaimed film.
rows.description: MEXICO CITY — There is a minor but crucial character in the film “Roma” who isn’t listed in the credits and appears onscreen only for a fleeting moment. He’s mostly heard, not seen. Yet he makes a deep emotional mark on the movie.

rows.headline: At Allbirds and Birkenstock in SoHo, the Critical Shopper embarks, skeptically, on a search for styling footwear.
rows.description: People who buy shoes for comfort are cops.

rows.headline: Daniela Soto-Innes, a co-owner of the acclaimed restaurants Cosme and Atla, shares a trio of recipes inspired by her Mexican grandmother’s natural remedies.
rows.description: In our series My Detox, T asks creative people to share the homemade recipes they count on to cleanse and refresh.

rows.headline: One year after marijuana legalization California sales are down, tax revenues are well below forecasts and the black market thrives.
rows.description: SAN FRANCISCO — A billion dollars of tax revenue, the taming of the black market, the convenience of retail cannabis stores throughout the state — these were some of the promises made by proponents of marijuana legalization in California.

rows.headline: Britain’s Foreign Office brought home 82 women from forced marriages over two years, then billed them as much as $1,000 for their return.
rows.description: LONDON — It is a punishing coda to an already awful ordeal: British women who survive forced marriages abroad are rescued with help from the Foreign Office, only to have to repay the government for their escape.

rows.headline: The notion that limiting women’s reproduction can cure societal ills has a long, scary history.
rows.description: Over the past decade, more and more women have begun using long-acting, reversible birth control methods like intrauterine devices and implants. These birth control methods are highly effective at preventing pregnancy but were previously not widely accessible because of high costs and lack of knowledge among health care providers. Increasing access to these methods, for women who want them, is a sign of progress.

rows.headline: “What’s he done for me? How has he done in Afghanistan? Not too good,” Mr. Trump said of his former defense secretary. “I’m not happy with what he’s done in Afghanistan, and I shouldn’t be happy.”
rows.description: President Trump said on Wednesday that he had “essentially” fired Defense Secretary Jim Mattis last month because he was dissatisfied with Mr. Mattis’s performance in the top civilian job at the Pentagon.

rows.headline: Europe’s central bank took control of troubled Banca Carige, an unprecedented step to manage risk as Italy’s political and economic woes continue.
rows.description: FRANKFURT — The European Central Bank took control of a troubled Italian bank Wednesday, an unprecedented step that spotlighted the risks to the eurozone’s financial system from political chaos in Rome and a sputtering economy.

rows.headline: A vibrant visual arts community offers museums and alternative spaces in which to commune and ponder how to move forward.
rows.description: For the art world, the biggest news coming out of Pittsburgh last year should have been the opening of the 57th edition of the Carnegie International, the oldest survey exhibition of visual art in the United States. Instead, news of that exhibition was eclipsed in October by a shooting at the progressive Tree of Life Synagogue in the Squirrel Hill neighborhood of Pittsburgh, which killed 11 people and wounded six.

rows.headline: Complaints of sexual harassment and pay disparity by former campaign staff members, which have gone unaddressed by the Vermont senator, could hinder a second presidential run.
rows.description: In February 2016, Giulianna Di Lauro, a Latino outreach strategist for Senator Bernie Sanders’s presidential operation, complained to her supervisor that she had been harassed by a campaign surrogate whom she drove to events ahead of the Democratic primary in Nevada.

rows.headline: Driven by fear of persecution and economic mismanagement, the exodus threatens to reorder the society permanently and set Turkey back decades.
rows.description: ISTANBUL — For 17 years, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan won elections by offering voters a vision of restoring the glories of Turkey’s Ottoman past. He extended his country’s influence with increased trade and military deployments, and he raised living standards with years of unbroken economic growth.

rows.headline: The book, “Showtime at the Apollo” by Ted Fox, is a tribute to the Harlem cultural institution, which celebrates its 85th anniversary this month.
rows.description: The graphic novel “Showtime at the Apollo: The Epic Tale of Harlem’s Legendary Theater” is like a sprawling Hollywood biopic. A sea of boldface names — James Brown, the Jackson Five, Dionne Warwick and countless others — make their way through the theater.

rows.headline: The ban comes as dozens of gun control measures have been passed across the country, spurred on by public pressure after deadly mass killings. The N.R.A. has filed suit.
rows.description: People under 21 are no longer able to buy semiautomatic assault rifles in Washington as of Jan 1. It is the first of several new state measures intended to reduce gun violence. The National Rifle Association has already filed suit.

rows.headline: More Chinese companies went public in the United States in 2018 than in any year since 2014.
rows.description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

rows.headline: A surprise announcement added to concerns about the ability of American tech giants to navigate an increasingly uncertain economy and a trade war with China.
rows.description: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple reduced its revenue expectations for the first time in 16 years on Wednesday because of poor iPhone sales in China, an unexpected development that underscored the slowing of China’s economy and raised fears of further turmoil in global markets.

rows.headline: In Sweden, midwives deliver babies. But doula culture interpreters act as bridges between midwives and immigrant women.
rows.description: HALMSTAD, Sweden — Maria Hussein, who escaped the war in Syria, was many hours into labor in a Swedish hospital when the midwife realized her fetus was in distress, and called in an obstetrician to help.

rows.headline: As a candidate, President Jair Bolsonaro compared indigenous communities living in isolated areas to animals in zoos.
rows.description: RIO DE JANEIRO — President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil, who has compared indigenous communities living in protected lands to animals in zoos, took a major step toward undermining the rights of indigenous people just hours after taking office on Tuesday.

rows.headline: A law that took effect on Tuesday makes California the first state to bar the sale of dogs, cats and rabbits that do not come from shelters or rescue organizations.
rows.description: California this week became the first state in the nation to bar pet stores from selling dogs, cats and rabbits unless they come from animal shelters or rescue groups.

rows.headline: The authorities in the Houston area have increased patrols since a 7-year-old girl was shot inside a car on Sunday. They’re also taking a fresh look at a similar — and unsolved — 2017 shooting.
rows.description: In the days after Jazmine Barnes, 7, was fatally shot inside a moving car near a Walmart outside Houston on Sunday morning, the police have released just one concrete clue about her killer: an image of a red pickup truck recorded by a surveillance camera near the scene of the shooting.

rows.headline: The teenager was said to have been throwing eggs at cars in Houston on Tuesday before being chased by another driver and crashing into a pickup truck.
rows.description: A 14-year-old Texas boy who was said to have been throwing eggs at cars was charged with murder after he crashed into a pickup truck and killed a woman while being chased by another driver, the authorities said on Wednesday.
